intro: Astragalus seydishehiricus, commonly known as the Seydishehir milkvetch, is a flowering plant native to Turkey. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, pea-like flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or arid environments, showcasing its adaptability to harsh conditions. It is known for its deep root system, which helps it survive in nutrient-poor soils. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
